titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in

defitem.label: Processed by: Betsy Reed, Graduate Student and Kira A. Dietz, Archivist,

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of Robert F. Graeff a professor of architecture at Virginia Tech. The papers include photographs, handbooks, and design plans/instructions for design primarily relating the bathroom facilities.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Robert F. Graeff Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Robert F. Graeff Papers Ms2015-012, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Robert F. Graeff Papers were donated to Special Collections in 2014 after being received by the Art and Architecture Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Robert F. Graeff Papers was completed in April 2015.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert F. Graeff was a professor of architecture in the College of Architecture and Urban Studies at Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University from 1978 to 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the papers of Robert F. Graeff a professor of architecture at Virginia Tech. The papers include the Center for Product and Environmental Design (CAUS) publications, photographs, drawings and design materials relating to Graeff's designs for accessible bathrooms for the elderly. Although the majority of the materials are not dated, they are mostly from the 1970s and 1980s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in the collection were foldered by publication or material type. Folders in the collection are arranged in alphabetical order.
